page.title: 09Changing Times
page.content: In {Desborough,}many years ago at the back of{Loatland Street}there was a railway line which used to be called {"Puffin' Billy".}This has all gone now and the land is now covered by houses. There have not been many changes in Desborough but the Leisure Centre has been built recently. Many buildings have been knocked down and a lot of old people's homes have been built. 14 shops have been knocked down and 4 have been rebuilt.Most houses are built on ironstone foundations. There were lots of shoe factories including {Cheaney's; Crampton's; Groocock's; {Turner's}and{Normsby's.}7 or 8 of these factories have been closed. The population has increased from 24,000 to 60,000. Lots of little shops have been closed but a lot more have been built.
